post.description:
OpenAI compatible `/chat/completions` endpoint for LLM inference.
Check the OpenAI
[API reference](https://platform.openai.com/docs/api-reference/chat)
for the most updated documentation. The ground truth is always the latest OpenAI API
Reference. The arguments below are copied for convenience, but might not be fully
up-to-date at all times.

get.description: Returns a list of the tags in your account

schema.title: Response Get Query Tags V0 Tags Get

get.description: Get the queries history, optionally for a given set of tags for a narrowed search.

parameters.name: tags

schema.description: Tags to filter for queries that are marked with these tags.
schema.title: Tags

parameters.description: Tags to filter for queries that are marked with these tags.

parameters.name: endpoints

schema.description: Optionally specify an endpoint, or a list of endpoints to filter for
schema.title: Endpoints

parameters.description: Optionally specify an endpoint, or a list of endpoints to filter for

parameters.name: start_time

schema.description: Timestamp of the earliest query to aggregate. Format is `YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm:ss`.
schema.title: Start Time

parameters.description: Timestamp of the earliest query to aggregate. Format is `YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm:ss`.

parameters.name: end_time

schema.description: Timestamp of the latest query to aggregate. Format is `YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm:ss`.
schema.title: End Time

parameters.description: Timestamp of the latest query to aggregate. Format is `YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm:ss`.

parameters.name: page_number

schema.description: The query history is returned in pages, with up to 100 prompts per page. Increase the page number to see older prompts.
schema.title: Page Number

parameters.description: The query history is returned in pages, with up to 100 prompts per page. Increase the page number to see older prompts.

get.description:
Returns aggregated telemetry data from previous queries to the `/chat/completions`
endpoint, specifically the p50 and p95 for generation time and tokens per second,
and also the total prompt and completion tokens processed within the interval. The
user id and total request count within the interval are also returned.

parameters.name: start_time

schema.description: Timestamp of the earliest query to aggregate. Format is `YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm:ss`.
schema.title: Start Time

parameters.description: Timestamp of the earliest query to aggregate. Format is `YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm:ss`.

parameters.name: end_time

schema.description: Timestamp of the latest query to aggregate. Format is `YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm:ss`.
schema.title: End Time

parameters.description: Timestamp of the latest query to aggregate. Format is `YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm:ss`.

parameters.name: models

schema.description: Models to fetch metrics from. The list must be a set of comma-separated strings. i.e. `gpt-3.5-turbo,gpt-4o`
schema.title: Models

parameters.description: Models to fetch metrics from. The list must be a set of comma-separated strings. i.e. `gpt-3.5-turbo,gpt-4o`

parameters.name: providers

schema.description: Providers to fetch metrics from. The list must be a set of comma-separated strings. i.e. `openai,together-ai`
schema.title: Providers

parameters.description: Providers to fetch metrics from. The list must be a set of comma-separated strings. i.e. `openai,together-ai`

parameters.name: interval

schema.description: Number of seconds in the aggregation interval.
schema.title: Interval

parameters.description: Number of seconds in the aggregation interval.

parameters.name: secondary_user_id

schema.description: Secondary user id. The secondary user id will match any string previously sent in the `user` attribute of `/chat/completions`.
schema.title: Secondary User Id

parameters.description: Secondary user id. The secondary user id will match any string previously sent in the `user` attribute of `/chat/completions`.

schema.title: Response Get Query Metrics V0 Metrics Get

post.description:
Creates a custom endpoint. This endpoint must either be a fine-tuned model from one
of the supported providers (`/v0/providers`), in which case the "provider" argument
must be set accordingly. Otherwise, the endpoint must support the OpenAI
`/chat/completions` format. To query your custom endpoint, replace your endpoint
string with `<name>@custom` when querying any general custom endpoint. You can show
all *custom* endpoints by querying `/v0/endpoints` and passing `custom` as the
`provider` argument.

parameters.name: name

schema.description: Alias for the custom endpoint. This will be the name used to call the endpoint.
schema.title: Name

parameters.description: Alias for the custom endpoint. This will be the name used to call the endpoint.

parameters.name: url

schema.description: Base URL of the endpoint being called. Must support the OpenAI format.
schema.title: Url

parameters.description: Base URL of the endpoint being called. Must support the OpenAI format.

parameters.name: key_name

schema.description: Name of the API key that will be passed as part of the query.
schema.title: Key Name

parameters.description: Name of the API key that will be passed as part of the query.

parameters.name: model_name

schema.description: Named passed to the custom endpoint as model name. If not specified, it will default to the endpoint alias.
schema.title: Model Name

parameters.description: Named passed to the custom endpoint as model name. If not specified, it will default to the endpoint alias.

parameters.name: provider

schema.description: If the custom endpoint is for a fine-tuned model which is hosted directly via one of the supported providers, then this argument should be specified as the provider used. The unification logic will be used for this custom fine-tuned model behind the scenes, in the same manner as used for the foundation models with the same provider.
schema.title: Provider

parameters.description: If the custom endpoint is for a fine-tuned model which is hosted directly via one of the supported providers, then this argument should be specified as the provider used. The unification logic will be used for this custom fine-tuned model behind the scenes, in the same manner as used for the foundation models with the same provider.

post.description:
Stores a custom API key from an LLM provider in your account. This can be done in
one of two ways:

1. As part of a custom endpoint. If you define a custom endpoint, you can reference
a custom API key. This will be sent to the endpoint as part of the request.

2. To use your own API keys with the standard providers. If any of your custom API
keys match a provider name and you pass `use_custom_keys=True` to the
`/chat/completions` endpoint, then this API key will be used, using your own
account with the provider directly.

parameters.name: name

schema.description: Name of the API key.
schema.title: Name

parameters.description: Name of the API key.

parameters.name: value

schema.description: Value of the API key.
schema.title: Value

parameters.description: Value of the API key.

post.description:
Uses the named `evaluator` to trigger an evaluation of quality scores for the
selected LLM `endpoint` on the selected `dataset`. You can upload custom scores (and
bypass the LLM judge entirely) by uploading a file via the `client_side_scores`
argument. Once the evaluation has finished, you can access the scores using the
`/v0/evaluation` endpoint. If a custom prompt is specified, its fields will overwrite
the corresponding fields in each one of the evaluated prompts.

parameters.name: evaluator

schema.description: Name of the evaluator to use. If not specified, 'default_evaluator' will be used.
schema.title: Evaluator

parameters.description: Name of the evaluator to use. If not specified, 'default_evaluator' will be used.

parameters.name: default_prompt

schema.description: Name of the default prompt to use.
schema.title: Default Prompt

parameters.description: Name of the default prompt to use.

parameters.name: dataset

schema.description: Name of the uploaded dataset to evaluate.
schema.title: Dataset

parameters.description: Name of the uploaded dataset to evaluate.

parameters.name: endpoint

schema.description: Name of the endpoint to evaluate. Endpoints must be specified using the `model@provider` format.
schema.title: Endpoint

parameters.description: Name of the endpoint to evaluate. Endpoints must be specified using the `model@provider` format.

schema.title: Response Trigger Evaluation V0 Evaluation Post

example.info: Dataset evaluation started! You will receive an email soon!

example.detail: Invalid input. Couldn't find endpoints [model_1@endpoint_1, model_2@endpoint_2].

get.description:
Fetches evaluation results on a given dataset, for a specific endpoint (optional)
based on a specific evaluator (optional). If no `evaluator` is provided, then scores
are returned for all valid evaluators. Similarly, if no `endpoint` is provided, then
scores are returned for all valid endpoints.

parameters.name: dataset

schema.description: Name of the dataset to fetch evaluation from.
schema.title: Dataset

parameters.description: Name of the dataset to fetch evaluation from.

parameters.name: endpoint

schema.description: The endpoint to fetch the evaluation for. If `None`, returns all available evaluations for the dataset and evaluator pair.
schema.title: Endpoint

parameters.description: The endpoint to fetch the evaluation for. If `None`, returns all available evaluations for the dataset and evaluator pair.

parameters.name: evaluator

schema.description: Name of the evaluator to fetch the evaluation for. If `None`, returns all available evaluations for the dataset and endpoint pair.
schema.title: Evaluator

parameters.description: Name of the evaluator to fetch the evaluation for. If `None`, returns all available evaluations for the dataset and endpoint pair.

parameters.name: per_prompt

schema.description: If `True`, returns the scores on a per-prompt level. By default set to `False`. If `True` requires an endpoint and evaluator to be set.
schema.title: Per Prompt

parameters.description: If `True`, returns the scores on a per-prompt level. By default set to `False`. If `True` requires an endpoint and evaluator to be set.

parameters.name: include_runtime

schema.description: If `True`, returns additional metrics regarding the runtime of the endpoint (ITL, TTFT, cost). By default set to `False`.
schema.title: Include Runtime

parameters.description: If `True`, returns additional metrics regarding the runtime of the endpoint (ITL, TTFT, cost). By default set to `False`.

schema.title: Response Get Evaluations V0 Evaluation Get

delete.description:
Deletes evaluations on a given dataset, for a specific endpoint (optional) based on
a specific evaluator (optional). If no `evaluator` is provided, then evaluations for
all valid evaluators are deleted. Similarly, if no `endpoint` is provided, then
evaluations for all valid endpoints are deleted.

parameters.name: dataset

schema.description: Name of the dataset to delete the evaluation for.
schema.title: Dataset

parameters.description: Name of the dataset to delete the evaluation for.

parameters.name: endpoint

schema.description: The endpoint to delete the evaluation for. If `None`, deletes the evaluations for all endpoints.
schema.title: Endpoint

parameters.description: The endpoint to delete the evaluation for. If `None`, deletes the evaluations for all endpoints.

parameters.name: evaluator

schema.description: Name of the evaluator to delete the evaluation for. If `None`, deletes all available evaluations for the dataset and endpoint pair.
schema.title: Evaluator

parameters.description: Name of the evaluator to delete the evaluation for. If `None`, deletes all available evaluations for the dataset and endpoint pair.

post.description:
Append speed or cost data to the standardized time-series benchmarks for a custom
endpoint (only custom endpoints are publishable by end users).

parameters.name: endpoint_name

schema.description: Name of the *custom* endpoint to append benchmark data for.
schema.title: Endpoint Name

parameters.description: Name of the *custom* endpoint to append benchmark data for.

parameters.name: metric_name

schema.description:
Name of the metric to submit. Allowed metrics are:
        "input-cost", "output-cost", "time-to-first-token", "inter-token-latency".
schema.title: Metric Name

parameters.description:
Name of the metric to submit. Allowed metrics are:
        "input-cost", "output-cost", "time-to-first-token", "inter-token-latency".

parameters.name: value

schema.description: Value of the metric to submit.
schema.title: Value

parameters.description: Value of the metric to submit.

parameters.name: measured_at

schema.description: The timestamp to associate with the submission. Defaults to current time if unspecified.
schema.title: Measured At

parameters.description: The timestamp to associate with the submission. Defaults to current time if unspecified.

get.description:
Extracts cost and speed data for the provided endpoint via our standardized
efficiency benchmarks, in the specified region, with the specified sequence length,
with all benchmark values returned within the specified time window.

When extracting data for a *custom* endpoint, then `model` is the endpoint name, and
`provider` must be set as `"custom"`. The arguments `region` and `seq_len` are
ignored for custom endpoints (they are not publishable).

If neither `start_time` nor `end_time` are provided, then only the *latest*
benchmark data is returned. If only `start_time` is provided, then `end_time` is
assumed to be the current time. An exception is raised if only `end_time` is
provided.

parameters.name: model

schema.description: Name of the model.
schema.title: Model

parameters.description: Name of the model.

parameters.name: provider

schema.description: Name of the provider.
schema.title: Provider

parameters.description: Name of the provider.

parameters.name: region

schema.description:
Region where the benchmark is run.
        Options are: `"Belgium"`, `"Hong Kong"` or `"Iowa"`.
schema.title: Region

parameters.description:
Region where the benchmark is run.
        Options are: `"Belgium"`, `"Hong Kong"` or `"Iowa"`.

parameters.name: seq_len

schema.description: Length of the sequence used for benchmarking, can be short or long
schema.title: Seq Len

parameters.description: Length of the sequence used for benchmarking, can be short or long

parameters.name: start_time

schema.description: Window start time. Only returns the latest benchmark if unspecified
schema.title: Start Time

parameters.description: Window start time. Only returns the latest benchmark if unspecified

parameters.name: end_time

schema.description: Window end time. Assumed to be the current time if this is unspecified *and* start_time *is* specified. Only the latest benchmark is returned if both are unspecified.
schema.title: End Time

parameters.description: Window end time. Assumed to be the current time if this is unspecified *and* start_time *is* specified. Only the latest benchmark is returned if both are unspecified.

schema.title: Response Get Benchmark V0 Benchmark Get

The time-series benchmark data for *public* endpoints are not deletable.

post.description:

across. To *use* a custom-trained router, you will need to deploy the resulting
artifacts to a live endpoint, via the `/router/deploy` `POST` endpoint.

`router-abc@q:1` endpoint.

get.description:
Fetches a list of the *deployed* routers and relevant metadata (excluding the
trained but undeployed routers). To fetch a list of *all* trained routers (both
deployed and undeployed), you can use the `/router/list` `GET` endpoint.

To use any of these routers, replace the model in the endpoint string with the
router name. E.g. you can use `router-abc` with the endpoint `router-abc@q:1`.

schema.title: Response List Deployed Routers V0 Router Deploy List Get

query_body.description: A JSON object containing the body of the request

response_body.title: Response Body

message.content:
Sir Isaac Newton was an English mathematician, physicist, and astronomer who lived from 1643 to 1727.

He is widely recognized as one of the most influential scientists in history, and his work laid the foundation for the Scientific Revolution of the 17th century.

Newton's most famous achievement is his theory of universal gravitation, which he presented in his groundbreaking book "Philosophiæ Naturalis Principia Mathematica" in 1687.

According to Newton's theory, every

timestamp.title: Timestamp
timestamp.description: A timestamp (if not set, will be the time of sending)

client_side_scores.title: Client Side Scores
client_side_scores.description: An optional file upload for client-side scores. The file must be in JSONL format and the prompts must match the order of the `dataset`. Each entry should include `prompt_id` and `score` keys, with `score` being a float between 0 and 1. The evaluation corresponding to the `evaluator` must have `client_side=True`.

file.title: File
file.description: The contents of the `.jsonl` file being uploaded.

name.title: Name
name.description: The name to give to this dataset.

messages.title: Messages
messages.description: A list of messages comprising the conversation so far.

model.title: Model
model.description: The endpoint to use, in the format `{model}@{provider}`, based on any of the supported endpoints as per the list returned by `/v0/endpoints`

max_tokens.title: Max Tokens
max_tokens.description:
The maximum number of tokens that can be generated in the chat completion.

The total length of input tokens and generated tokens is limited by the model's context length.

stop.title: Stop
stop.description: Up to 4 sequences where the API will stop generating further tokens.

stream.title: Stream
stream.description: If set, partial message deltas will be sent. Tokens will be sent as data-only server-sent events as they become available, with the stream terminated by a `data: [DONE]` message.

temperature.title: Temperature
temperature.description:
What sampling temperature to use, between 0 and 2. Higher values like 0.8 will make the output more random, while lower values like 0.2 will make it more focused and deterministic.

Generally recommended to alter this or `top_p`, but not both.

frequency_penalty.title: Frequency Penalty
frequency_penalty.description: Number between -2.0 and 2.0. Positive values penalize new tokens based on their existing frequency in the text so far, decreasing the model's likelihood to repeat the same line verbatim.

logit_bias.title: Logit Bias
logit_bias.description:
Modify the likelihood of specified tokens appearing in the completion.

Accepts a JSON object that maps tokens (specified by their token ID in the tokenizer) to an associated bias value from -100 to 100. Mathematically, the bias is added to the logits generated by the model prior to sampling. The exact effect will vary per model, but values between -1 and 1 should decrease or increase likelihood of selection; values like -100 or 100 should result in a ban or exclusive selection of the relevant token.

logprobs.title: Logprobs
logprobs.description: Whether to return log probabilities of the output tokens or not. If true, returns the log probabilities of each output token returned in the `content` of `message`.

top_logprobs.title: Top Logprobs
top_logprobs.description: An integer between 0 and 20 specifying the number of most likely tokens to return at each token position, each with an associated log probability. `logprobs` must be set to `true` if this parameter is used.

n.title: N
n.description: How many chat completion choices to generate for each input message. Note that you will be charged based on the number of generated tokens across all of the choices. Keep `n` as `1` to minimize costs.

presence_penalty.title: Presence Penalty
presence_penalty.description: Number between -2.0 and 2.0. Positive values penalize new tokens based on whether they appear in the text so far, increasing the model's likelihood to talk about new topics.

response_format.title: Response Format
response_format.description:
An object specifying the format that the model must output.

Setting to `{ "type": "json_schema", "json_schema": {...} }` enables Structured Outputs which ensures the model will match your supplied JSON schema.

Setting to `{ "type": "json_object" }` enables JSON mode, which ensures the message the model generates is valid JSON.

**Important:** when using JSON mode, you **must** also instruct the model to produce JSON yourself via a system or user message. Without this, the model may generate an unending stream of whitespace until the generation reaches the token limit, resulting in a long-running and seemingly "stuck" request. Also note that the message content may be partially cut off if `finish_reason="length"`, which indicates the generation exceeded `max_tokens` or the conversation exceeded the max context length.

seed.title: Seed
seed.description: If specified, the system will make a best effort to sample deterministically, such that repeated requests with the same `seed` and parameters should return the same result. Determinism is not guaranteed, and you should refer to the `system_fingerprint` response parameter to monitor changes in the backend.

stream_options.title: Stream Options
stream_options.description: Options for streaming response. Only set this when you set `stream: true`.

top_p.title: Top P
top_p.description:
An alternative to sampling with temperature, called nucleus sampling, where the model considers the results of the tokens with top_p probability mass. So 0.1 means only the tokens comprising the top 10% probability mass are considered.

Generally recommended to alter this or `temperature` but not both.

tools.title: Tools
tools.description: A list of tools the model may call. Currently, only functions are supported as a tool. Use this to provide a list of functions the model may generate JSON inputs for. A max of 128 functions are supported.

tool_choice.title: Tool Choice
tool_choice.description:
Controls which (if any) tool is called by the model. `none` means the model will not call any tool and instead generates a message.`auto` means the model can pick between generating a message or calling one or more tools. `required` means the model must call one or more tools. Specifying a particular tool via `{"type": "function", "function": {"name": "my_function"}}` forces the model to call that tool.

`none` is the default when no tools are present. `auto` is the default if tools are present.

parallel_tool_calls.title: Parallel Tool Calls
parallel_tool_calls.description: Whether to enable parallel function calling during tool use.

user.title: User
user.description: A unique identifier representing your end-user.

signature.title: Signature
signature.description: A string used to represent where the request came from, for examples, did it come via the Python package, the NodeJS package, the chat interface etc. This should *not* be set by the user.

use_custom_keys.title: Use Custom Keys
use_custom_keys.description: Whether or not to use custom API keys with the specified provider, meaning that you will be using your own account with that provider in the backend.

tags.title: Tags
tags.description: Comma-separated list of tags to associate with the corresponding prompt.

drop_params.title: Drop Params
drop_params.description: Whether or not to drop unsupported OpenAI params by the provider you're using

region.title: Region
region.description: A string used to represent the region where the endpoint is accessed. This is only relevant for certain providers like `vertex-ai` and `aws-bedrock`, where the endpoint is being accessed through a specified region.

log_query_body.title: Log Query Body
log_query_body.description: Whether to log the contents of the query json body.

log_response_body.title: Log Response Body
log_response_body.description: Whether to log the contents of the response json body.

ChatCompletionRequest.title: ChatCompletionRequest
ChatCompletionRequest.description:
Request model for chat completion based language model.

Attributes:
    model (str): The model identifier.
    messages (List[Dict[str]]): List of messages for completion.
    temperature (float): The temperature parameter for generating completions.
    stream (bool): Whether to stream the response.

ChatCompletionResponse.title: ChatCompletionResponse
ChatCompletionResponse.description:
Response model for chat completion based language model.

Attributes:
    model (str): The model identifier.
    created (int): Timestamp indicating when the response was created.
    id (str): Identifier for the completion response.
    object (str): The type of object, defaults to "chat.completion".
    usage (dict): Usage statistics or additional information.
    choices (List[Dict]): List of completion choices.

CreditsResponse.title: CreditsResponse
CreditsResponse.description:
Response model for credits models.

Attributes:
    id (str): The id of the users.
    credits (float): The credits of the users.

name.title: Name
name.description: A unique, user-defined name used when referencing  the default prompt.

prompt.title: Prompt
prompt.description: Prompt fields that will override any field in the prompt to be evaluated when triggering an evaluation.

name.title: Name
name.description: A unique, user-defined name used when referencing and triggering the evaluation.

system_prompt.title: System Prompt
system_prompt.description: An optional custom system prompt to provide specific instructions to the judge on how to score the answers.

class_config.title: Class Config
class_config.description:
If set, describes the list of classifications that the LLM judge uses to
            score each prompt. For example:
```
[{"label": "Excellent", "score": 1.0, "description": "A perfect answer with no factual
mistakes"},
{"label": "Good", "score": 0.5, "description": "An average answer"},
{"label": "Bad", "score": 0.0, "description": "An incorrect answer, containing a
significant factual mistake"}]
```

judge_models.title: Judge Models
judge_models.description: Specifies the LLM(s) to be used as the judge. This can be a string containing a single model name or a list of model names.

client_side.title: Client Side
client_side.description: Indicates whether evaluations are performed on the client-side. If `True`, the LLM judge is bypassed, and results are uploaded via the `trigger` endpoint.
